etymology.description: 手(手) (shǒu, "hand") + phonetic: 牚(牚) (chēng, "prop up") = action involving the hand -> support or prop up
etymology.interpretation: The character 撐(撐) (chēng, "support") brings together the concept of a hand, represented by 手(手) (shǒu, "hand"), with the phonetic component 牚(牚) (chēng, "prop up"), to convey the idea of using one's hand to physically support or prop something up.

examples.chinese: 他用木棍撑起破旧的屋顶(他用木棍撐起破舊的屋頂)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yòng mùgùn chēng qǐ pòjiù de wūdǐng。
examples.english: He propped up the dilapidated roof with a wooden stick.

examples.chinese: 朋友们的鼓励撑起了他的信心(朋友們的鼓勵撐起了他的信心)，让他勇敢面对挑战(讓他勇敢面對挑戰)。
examples.pinyin: Péngyǒumen de gǔlì chēng qǐle tā de xìnxīn, ràng tā yǒnggǎn miànduì tiǎozhàn。
examples.english: The encouragement from his friends supported his confidence, enabling him to face challenges bravely.
